intro: Columnea segregata, commonly known as the red-tipped pineapple plant, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Columnea segregata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
